column4: Note: Host seems down. If it is really up, but blocking our ping probes, try -PN
Nmap done: 1 IP address (0 hosts up) scanned in 2.35 seconds
you don't need nmap to test a 1 port service, just telnet to the vnc  port nr
and btw, you did try to ping the host first, right ?
did you checked connectivity between the vnc client and server with a "ping host" ?
but it fails with the stock vnc from the same system ?
with telnet you can check connectivity to a specific port
AH.. ok I just caught up. I was typing the nmap command wrong. NMAP reports 5900/tcp poen vnc
so it's not a network issue
Whoa..  now it works.. the only change was installing nmap....  weird or understandable?
it is not related to nmap in anyway
the only error was "failed to connect to server" from XP to Linux, and "5900 is closed" from Linux to XP. However, both directions work now.
